tweets.text: @ShaunLintern thank you Shaun , can we just add that @EnvAgencyMids have basically said that red can carry on as usual and they're not going to strictly enforce any sanctions.

@NrtSam @PJennings88 @RiverChess @EnvAgency Why should recovering EA costs be a driver? The EA aren't there to operate as a corporate entity. The EA is supposed to act as the environmental watchdog/enforcer and uphold the law. It fails because the lines between it & corporates have been blurred. It's priorities are wrong.

Following the fire at a former waste site in #Telford last week our officers are also monitoring the #RiverSevern from south #Shrewsbury to north of #Gloucester to check for any environmental impacts

tweets.text: The smell and high hydrogen sulphide levels suggest gypsum being deposited. Gypsum should be landfilled in a mono-cell. This has been the rule for years but like much else never enforced adequately by @EnvAgency. https://t.co/PjUQ5dQNCZ
I think we can all agree the foul stink and the frequency of it - both night and day - is getting worse not better. Cap it off and restore the site.  @StinkStopthe https://t.co/JIQ9gqhCtr

Having symptoms day in day out is hell, we have no end in sight we feel hopeless prisoner in our homes that @RedIndustries2 have turned into gas chambers @EnvAgency letting it carry on we can’t take anymore give us our lives back #StopTheStink @Cap_it_off #fridaymorning https://t.co/m15jqoRGQN

urls.title: B-lines | Shropshire Wildlife Trust
urls.description: The B-Lines are a series of ‘insect pathways’ running through our countryside and towns, along which we are restoring and creating a series of wildflower-rich habitat stepping stones. They link existing wildlife areas together, creating a network, like a railway, that will weave across the British landscape.

tweets.text:
More about the Shropshire B-Lines project 🐝:
👉https://t.co/UscYz7UTzb
& tune in to the webinar with @Buzz_dont_tweet below👇

tweets.text: Following consultation with our partners and other environmental organisations over risks to nesting birds, the start of vegetation clearance work in preparation for the Lower Otter Restoration Project has been postponed. [1/3] https://t.co/YRdrZC9HLJ

Our enforcement officers, @AnglingTrust volunteers & @LancsPolice were cracking down on illegal fishing over the bank holiday weekend as part of Operation Clampdown 9. The patrol covered significant areas around #Preston where 3 offences were detected for unlicensed fishing. https://t.co/B3duYyTBJh

The coarse fish close season has started. This means it’s illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15th June inclusive.  

Don’t forget, there are plenty of still waters or canal coarse fisheries where you can fish. 

Learn more: https://t.co/u6IhTpkgUB https://t.co/ujbBmr7aUX
